conclusion: Understand principles of electromagnetic induction and behavior of square coil in magnetic field
Magnetic field is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of the coil
Coil has n turns and a side length of a
Plane of the coil is perpendicular to the magnetic field
Direction of magnetic induction intensity remains unchanged
Magnitude of magnetic induction intensity increases from B to 2B during time interval Δt
Induced EMF in a coil can be calculated using EMF = n * (dΦ/dt)
n is the number of turns in the coil and dΦ/dt is the rate of change of magnetic flux through the coil
Magnetic flux through the coil is Φ = B * a * n
Rate of change of magnetic flux is dΦ/dt = n * (dB/dt) * a
Calculate rate of change of magnetic flux: dΦ/dt = n * (2B - B)/Δt * a = n * B/Δt * a
Substitute into EMF formula: EMF = n * B/Δt * a
EMF induced in the coil during time interval Δt is EMF = n * B/Δt * a
